thread.title: Bankers challenge chancellor to change his surcharge on profits
thread.title_full: Bankers challenge chancellor to change his surcharge on profits

title: Bankers challenge chancellor to change his surcharge on profits
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Bankers challenge chancellor to change his surcharge on profits In the letter, the bankers say that the amount of capital needed to pay the new tax will have to be diverted from funds that could be used for lending Getty Images Google+ 1 of 1 In the letter, the bankers say that the amount of capital needed to pay the new tax will have to be diverted from funds that could be used for lending Getty Images Katherine Griffiths Banking Editor Updated 55 minutes ago 
The new surcharge on banks’ profits will cut lending to small businesses by £10 billion and should be changed, the bosses of Britain’s challenger banks have told the chancellor. 
Fifteen industry executives have called for a meeting with George Osborne to express anger about the new tax, announced in the budget, on all banks making more than £25 million a year, drawing in smaller lenders and building societies. 
They plan to ask Mr Osborne to consider raising the level of profits at which the tax will kick in to about £200 million, or suggesting that it is not applied until Subscribe now
